025
026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool;
027
028import javax.tools.JavaFileObject;
029
030import com.sun.source.util.TreePath;
031import com.sun.tools.javac.code.Symbol.*;
032import com.sun.tools.javac.comp.Enter;
033import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.JCTree.*;
034import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Context;
035import com.sun.tools.javac.util.JCDiagnostic.DiagnosticPosition;
036
037import com.sun.tools.javac.util.List;
038
039import static com.sun.tools.javac.code.Kinds.Kind.*;
040import com.sun.tools.javac.main.JavaCompiler;
041
042/**
043 * Javadoc's own enter phase does a few things above and beyond that
044 * done by javac.
045 */
046public class JavadocEnter extends Enter {
047    public static JavadocEnter instance(Context context) {
048        Enter instance = context.get(enterKey);
049        if (instance == null)
050            instance = new JavadocEnter(context);
051        return (JavadocEnter) instance;
052    }
053
054    public static void preRegister(Context context) {
055        context.put(enterKey, (Context.Factory<Enter>) JavadocEnter::new);
056    }
057
058    protected JavadocEnter(Context context) {
059        super(context);
060        log = JavadocLog.instance0(context);
061        toolEnv = ToolEnvironment.instance(context);
062        compiler = JavaCompiler.instance(context);
063    }
064
065    final JavadocLog log;
066    final ToolEnvironment toolEnv;
067    final JavaCompiler compiler;
068
069    @Override
070    public void main(List<JCCompilationUnit> trees) {
071        // cache the error count if we need to convert Enter errors as warnings.
072        int nerrors = log.nerrors;
073        super.main(trees);
074        compiler.enterDone();
075        if (toolEnv.ignoreSourceErrors) {
076            log.nwarnings += (log.nerrors - nerrors);
077            log.nerrors = nerrors;
078        }
079    }
080
081    @Override
082    public void visitTopLevel(JCCompilationUnit tree) {
083        super.visitTopLevel(tree);
084        if (tree.sourcefile.isNameCompatible("package-info",
085            JavaFileObject.Kind.SOURCE)) {
086            JCPackageDecl pd = tree.getPackage();
087            TreePath tp = pd == null ? toolEnv.getTreePath(tree)
088                : toolEnv.getTreePath(tree, pd);
089            toolEnv.setElementToTreePath(tree.packge, tp);
090        }
091    }
092
093    @Override
094    public void visitClassDef(JCClassDecl tree) {
095        super.visitClassDef(tree);
096        if (tree.sym == null)
097            return;
098        if (tree.sym.kind == TYP || tree.sym.kind == ERR) {
099            ClassSymbol c = tree.sym;
100            toolEnv.setElementToTreePath(c,
101                toolEnv.getTreePath(env.toplevel, tree));
102            c.classfile = env.toplevel.sourcefile;
103        }
104    }
105
106    /** Don't complain about a duplicate class. */
107    @Override
108    protected void duplicateClass(DiagnosticPosition pos, ClassSymbol c) {
109    }
110
111}
